setDebugModeEnabled

public AFAdSDK setDebugModeEnabled(boolean use)
Description copied from interface: AFAdSDK
Specify if the library should be used in debug mode. When this mode is enabled, the ad sdk will provide uncapped test ads. By default, this mode is disabled and should be disabled when submitting your app to Google Play or other appstores

Specified by:
setDebugModeEnabled in interface AFAdSDK
Parameters:
use - true if the debug mode should be enabled, false if production mode should be enabled
Returns:
this ad sdk instance

setFeatures

public AFAdSDK setFeatures(java.util.List<AFAdSDK.AFSDKFeature> features)
Define the features you want to use in Appsfire SDK. Call before prepare() \note Defining this property will allow us to avoid unnecessary library process and web-services calls. For example, if you only use the Monetization SDK (AppsfireAdSDK), then you could set `AFSDKFeatureMonetization`. \warning Don't use this call if you aren't 100% sure about what you're doing.

Specified by:
setFeatures in interface AFAdSDK
Parameters:
features - list of features. You can enable one or more features. By default AFSDKFeatureEngage and AFSDKFeatureMonetization features are enabled.
Returns:
this ad sdk instance

                           Context c)

Display modal ad now or as soon as possible. A new request will cancel out a previous one if the previous one hasn't been handled yet

Parameters:

isAModalAdOfTypeAvailable

public boolean isAModalAdOfTypeAvailable(AFAdSDK.AFAdSDKModalType modalType)
Description copied from interface: AFAdSDK
Poll to ask if ads are loaded and if there is at least one modal ad available. The ad SDK also calls AFAdSDKEventsDelegate.onModalAdAvailable() to let the app know that modal ads are now ready for use.

Specified by:
isAModalAdOfTypeAvailable in interface AFAdSDK
Parameters:
modalType - the type of modal ad to check availability (AFAdSDKModalTypeSushi, AFAdSDKModalTypeUraMaki..)
Returns:
true if ads are loaded and if there is at least one modal ad of the requested type available, false otherwise

sashimiViewForFormat

public AFAdSDKSashimiView sashimiViewForFormat(AFAdSDK.AFAdSDKSashimiFormat format,
                                               AFAdSDK.AFAdSizeProvider sizeProvider,
                                               Context c)
Description copied from interface: AFAdSDK
Get a sashimi ad view ready to be inserted into an Android layout, from a template format

Specified by:
sashimiViewForFormat in interface AFAdSDK
Parameters:
format - The kind of sashimi view you would like to get.
sizeProvider - instance that provides the dimensions of the ad view
c - activity context in which modal ad is to be displayed
Returns:
A view containing an ad which can be displayed right now. In case a problem occurred, null could be returned.
